articles.headline: A ‘Bonfire’ Returns as Heartburn
articles.snippet: Visiting the New York Stock Exchange last year, Tom Wolfe, the author of “The Bonfire of the Vanities,” proclaimed that it was the end of capitalism as we knew it.
articles.abstract: Visiting the New York Stock Exchange last year, Tom Wolfe, the author of “The Bonfire of the Vanities,” proclaimed that it was the end of capitalism as we knew it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Almost exactly a year ago, Tom Wolfe, the author of “The Bonfire of the Vanities,” was wandering the floor of the New York Stock Exchange. Dressed in his trademark white suit, he darted around traders and whisked past trading booths, shaking hands and waving, just before the market was about to open.

articles.headline: China’s Visa Policy Threatens Olympics Tourism
articles.snippet: Heightened security measures ahead of the Olympics are taking a toll on the tourism industry in China.
articles.abstract: Heightened security measures ahead of the Olympics are taking a toll on the tourism industry in China.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING  The plush lobby of Beijing’s Kerry Center Hotel is usually crowded with foreign guests, many of them listening to jazz and sipping martinis in Centro, the hotel’s fashionable bar, or lining up for taxis after dinner at the Horizon restaurant.

articles.headline: At Google, Slow Growth in News Site
articles.snippet: Six years after its start, Google News is far from achieving the kind of dominant position in news that the company has in other areas.
articles.abstract: Six years after its start, Google News is far from achieving the kind of dominant position in news that the company has in other areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  The death of Tim Russert of NBC News this month quickly became a top article on the nation’s biggest news sites.

articles.headline: What’s Obscene? Google Could Have an Answer
articles.snippet: In a Florida trial, Google data will be used to argue that explicit material doesn’t violate community values.
articles.abstract: In a Florida trial, Google data will be used to argue that explicit material doesn’t violate community values.
articles.lead_paragraph: Judges and jurors who must decide whether sexually explicit material is obscene are asked to use a local yardstick: does the material violate community standards?

articles.headline: G.M. Offers Deals to Cut Overstock
articles.snippet: The announced production cuts and increased incentives, including no-interest loans, come as the automaker struggles amid a consumer exodus from pickups and sport utility vehicles.
articles.abstract: The announced production cuts and increased incentives, including no-interest loans, come as the automaker struggles amid a consumer exodus from pickups and sport utility vehicles.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  General Motors, which has struggled to stop depending on big discounts to draw in customers, is pulling the sale banners out again.
articles.byline: By Nick Bunkley and Bill Vlasic

articles.headline: Security Council Urges Zimbabwe to Halt Violence
articles.snippet: The United Nations Security Council issued a sweeping condemnation of the violence gripping Zimbabwe after the opposition leader, Morgan Tsvangirai, took refuge at the Dutch Embassy.
articles.abstract: The United Nations Security Council issued a sweeping condemnation of the violence gripping Zimbabwe after the opposition leader, Morgan Tsvangirai, took refuge at the Dutch Embassy.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS  With Zimbabwe’s opposition under siege and its leader taking refuge at the Dutch Embassy, the Security Council on Monday issued its first sweeping condemnation of the violence gripping the nation, saying it would be “impossible for a free and fair election to take place.”
articles.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Celia W. Dugger

articles.headline: Muslim Voters Detect a Snub From Obama
articles.snippet: Many Muslim Americans who have supported Barack Obama’s candidacy say he has not returned the embrace.
articles.abstract: Many Muslim Americans who have supported Barack Obama’s candidacy say he has not returned the embrace.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Senator Barack Obama courted voters in Iowa last December, Representative Keith Ellison, the country’s first Muslim congressman, stepped forward eagerly to help.

articles.headline: Home Depot Offers Recycling for Compact Fluorescent Bulbs
articles.snippet: Home Depot’s move will create the nation’s most widespread recycling program for the energy-saving bulbs, which have to be properly disposed of since they contain small amounts of mercury.
articles.abstract: Home Depot’s move will create the nation’s most widespread recycling program for the energy-saving bulbs, which have to be properly disposed of since they contain small amounts of mercury.
articles.lead_paragraph: Some big retailers are promoting compact fluorescent light bulbs as a way to save energy. But improper disposal of the bulbs creates a hazard, because they contain small amounts of mercury.
